intro: Baissea borneensis var. crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved balsam, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its large, fleshy, and often glossy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
